makers.displaydate: 1848–1903; born Paris, France; died Atuona, Marquesas Islands
makers.displaymaker: Paul Gauguin, 1848–1903; born Paris, France; died Atuona, Marquesas Islands

texts.textentryhtml: Paul Gauguin, Pont Avon, 1890; collection Ambroise Vollard, Paris; Dr. Sebraud, Paris; Jacques Dubourg, dealer; purchased by Kraushaar Gallery, New York; purchased by Leneold [sic] Sessler, Philadelphia; sold to G. M. Lauck, January 3, 1947. Peter Lauck, Class of 1940, and Annette Lauck; 1996 gift to Princeton University Art Museum.
texts.remarks: According to written notes of P. Lauck, dated September 1970 (based on information furnished by M. Zahn of Chas. Sessler, Philadelphia, Walnut Street.  Sept. 22, 1953):

bibliography.citation: Jill Guthrie, ed., In celebration: works of art from the Collections of Princeton Alumni and Friends of The Art Museum, Princeton University, (Princeton, NJ: Princeton University Art Museum, 1997)., p. 214, cat. no. 208 (illus.)

bibliography.boilertext: "Acquisitions of the Art Museum 1996," Record of the Art Museum, Princeton University 56, no. 1/2 (1997): p. 75-115.

caption: Paul Gauguin (1848–1903; born Paris, France; died Atuona, Marquesas Islands), Figures in an Interior [formerly: Vision d' artiste OR Vison of the Artist: Self-Portrait with Son), ca. 1890. Oil on canvas; 19.4 x 24.5 cm, 32 × 37 × 3.5 cm (frame). Gift of Peter Lauck, Class of 1940, and Annette Lauck (1996-239)
